title: Best App for Handwritten Notes during Lectures
comment: I've tried several android applications for taking handwritten notes during lectures, and this turned out to be the best one so far.  Pros:  - allow you to write directly where you want the text to be added (unlike handwrite note pro), so you can allocate the right amount of space  - it has a very clean and good pencil/pen. Despite my bad handwriting skills, the result is much more readable than with other programs. It looks like it does some additional "work" (rounding?) over the raw input of my hand movements, or has some other magic trick ;-)   - It is very easy, fast and cheap to switch pen modes, colors and erase errors, just like with a real book. Also, it allows to use a ruler, to help drawing straight lines for graphs and things like that.  Cons:  - i'm used to leave the weight of my hand over the book, but Quill looses fast the capability to detect what i write if i do so. I don't know if there is some way to solve this problem, may be related to the capacitive touch screen itself. But again, this is not an issue so far  I think I spent well my money here, the Tablet has now the functionality for which i purchased it :-)

title: Almost perfect
comment: I'm an EE student, tutor, and intern, and quill replaced all of my class and work notebooks and my whiteboard.  It works very well as advertised, but is missing a couple of features that you would otherwise expect to see.  The eraser, for one, can only delete entire lines, not portions of lines, so if you write cursive, you can't touch up a single letter without having to re-write the entire word.  The trade off, however is that you can very quickly erase large paragraphs or drawings.  The other thing that's missing is the ability to select text to copy/cut and paste.  That said, Quill and the digitized pen are the two things that sold me on the Lenovo Thinkpad, and I'm not disappointed.  The palm rejection works very well, and the two finger scrolling allows seamless transition between writing and repositioning your "paper."  It's extremely easy to organize your notes/assignments/projects into their own separate notebooks and the tagging pages makes finding that one schematic/poem/whatever a breeze to find, and converting the notes to PDF or transferring to Evernote makes saving or sharing your notes just as easy.  Quill is a very solid app lacking only a few expected features.

But I don't understand why a few things haven't been added (in my view this would make Quill a complete application - now it's annoying at times): 1. Why can't one order the different notes in a user-defined sort order on the main switch note screen 2. Why can't one set a default note type and have it endure to all new notes 3. Why can't one edit the graphics on the note (i.e. select some text and then cut/copy it)  Also, it's irritating that it adds underscores where I'd put spaces in the file name during export and I don't think the updating works well with Evernote; as far as I can tell it writes a new note when you re-export with the same filename. It also adds the Android path name to the Evernote filename which is not helpful at all (you then have to go and edit the Evernote filenames to recreate the filename you wanted in the first place).

comment: I think it is the best pen tool available. I have used the free version for several months now. And it is getting better and better. So I decided to support the developer by buying the market version!

title: A real leap forward in functionality on my HTC Flyer
comment: Great job. Maybe work on getting the Flyer pen's buttons to work but that's just greedy I guess....

title: Need Fountain Pen
comment: It was good until it was updated to assume that I don't have a digitizer... I'm using a Motorola Xoom and the Fountain Pen worked fine for me.

title: Flawless!
comment: This app is the best app - by far - in the market! Its inexpensive and it works GREAT! It has a simple UI and it doesn't take 5 hours to figure it out like other apps I've tried. I'm a college student and i need something that's reliable and easy to manuever! Hopefully some new pen styles and highlighters in the near future? :)

title: I've tried them All... this is the best
comment: I havea Thinkpad Tablet (honeycomb 3.1) with the digital n-trig stylus... I was holding out hope that Antipaper or Writepad Stylus apps would fix some minor annoyances... but it seems the developers are simply not investing enough time iterating on new versions (especially Antipaper).   Quill is by far the best app for writing notes out there. In addition to the 2 competitors mentioned above I've purchased several other apps but none come close the the functionality and sheer joy of using Quill.   There are some areas that can be improved in Quill... but I only view them as "nice to haves"... and based on how frequently the developer releases updates I think it's only a matter of time until these "wants" are addressed.  Keep up the great work!

title: One of best note taking apps
comment: Quill and Freenote are the best note taking apps for tablets right now. Quill has an edge because the way Freenote organizes pages is very klunky. Also, Quill supports export to PDFs and produces very good looking PDF output.  The fact that it is open source makes it the clear winner.  Two features that are missing (but coming soon)  are the ability to enter text using a keyboard and the ability to import images.

title: Amazing app
comment: If i could i would give you guys 6 stars. Keep up the very good work :)

title: Great app
comment: Works perfectly!

title: To laggy
comment: Right now it is to laggy to be useful. Will check back on this one in a couple months

title: Definitely not the best
comment: I have the new transformer prime and still the reaction time is not super smooth....  Could use more options

title: Perfect with Active Digitizer
comment: This app makes writing/drawing/taking notes on a tablet nearly perfect.  (Though having an active digitizer significantly improves functionality)  I have completely replaced paper/pencil with my Thinkpad Tablet thanks to Quill!  Volker (developer) is lightning fast with updates and very responsive to user requests.  Very impressive for one guy with some free time.

title: Minor improvements needed
comment: This app is a pretty amazing note taking application but could do with a few improvements.   When you press the up button on the notebook view it goes back to the view of the note pages, working like a back button instead of a button for climbing the hierarchy.   Also, since ICS you can hide the built in bar on devices without root, or at least make it disappear.   With these changes the app would improve a good bit, specially the first which is part of the android design documents.

title: I miss the fountain pen :(
comment: Great app but update removed the fountain pen. Also it needs to take use two finger or gesture navigation. Clicking the navigation button is slow.
Best writing app so far

title: Worth every cent
comment: Awesome app, great responsiveness. For just $1 dollar I think it couldn't be better. Using it on Motorola Xoom.

title: No option for refund!
comment: Navigation is poor. No option for refund within 15 minutes. Don't like that!

title: User friendly?? Continued
comment: Uploaded my last review before I was done. The application is cumbersome to use and not straight forward.Perphaps the application could initially open with the screen listing all available notes and whether one wishes to create a new one.  Saving the notes wasn't quite clear  either. Perhaps a modification to the menu to list the basic operations such as "New', "Save" and a few basic operations would be nice.  Other than that, the application is great and the pen response is excellent.
Great

title: Great program for college
comment: One or two additions would make it excellent.

title: Best hand writing app
comment: Keep up the updates
Best writing app out there

title: Great app
comment: Nice work

title: Nice Writing App
comment: Great app for just simply writing, probably the smoothest out there, although it could use some more features. It would be nice if there was a baseline for writing large and then formatting small on a line like some other writing apps. Also, optional keyboard input and picture imbedding would be nice, too!

title: Still new: gorgeously subtle innovation
comment: Not a ton of up-front glitz, but a fast interface (for user and gadget) that you can download right before a class/meeting and use easily out-of-the-box, then start to discover its attention to detail and realize how easy it was to use (especially compared to the competition). Based on vector graphics, exports PDFs easily and sends to Evernote, but that's it... for now. Dev is active, enthusiastic & skilled. The pressure sensitivity is well-crafted for TPT and palm rejection perfect for me so far. I'm pretty sure it won't retain its affordability (get it while it's still a buck).

title: Great
comment: Nice app

title: Amazing
comment: It  does ever thing I expected my HTC view to do but still doesn't the interface is great and I would have paid way more bc it works amazing!
Just cool!

title: It ok but not that great
comment: For me at least, It works fine if I write slow.  If i write to fast the line skips so an "e" will look like a "c".  I find that I have to some in pretty close to the text I do write does not cover 3 or 4 lines at once.  Do not recommend if you want something were you have to write something quickly.

title: Great handwriting sensitivity
comment: Best I've seen yet in terms of stylus sensitivity and handwriting accuracy

title: Pretty good
comment: Pretty good app. Better than other writing apps I've tried. But not quite as responsive and smooth on a Xoom as I expected.

title: Notes
comment: Best app I have to take notes on

title: Very good
comment: The speed and accuracy of this app are great. I only wish that the page would auto scroll when you get to the end so you didnt have to keep toggling between pen and move modes.

title: The best so far for capacitive screens
comment: I love my Tablet PC using ONENOTE, so my standards are high. Although this app. misses that threshold, it is about the best you can get on a capacitive screen so I give it 5 STARS. Lots of possibilities.

title: This could be useful
comment: Trying this out and liking it so far. It's odd that my finger-writing is more legible and faster in cursive, which I'd almost forgotten how to use. It's great that it can be used with Evernote.

title: Very nice for HTC flyer
comment: BRILLIANT!!! This is just what i have been looking for and this app is so much better than HTC flyer notes for hand writing esp when you want to write down equations etc

title: Very nice
comment: Impressed with how well it responds! Better automatic integration with evernote would make this 5 stars

title: i like it
comment: still trying it, very cool

title: Better than paper and pen
comment: I can't speak for other tablets, but this app is abosolutely, without a doubt, the greatest note taking and handwriting app for the Lenovo Thinkpad Tablet. The writing is so smooth and fast, it feels easier than pen and paper.

title: Awesome
comment: The killer app for devices like htc flyer!

title: This is the best note pen app by far.
comment: This app has been very useful for me.  Yeah, I am old school when it's time for note taking.  I like to use a pen for taking down daily notes as I find it is much quicker when I'm on the phone.  This would have 5 stars if it was able to edit the notebook titles.  Maybe there is a a way but user ducumentation is not easy to find, if it exists.  Otherwise great job folks I particularly like the palm rest feature for working without interuption at the bottom of the page. And it is the user who decides whether to use the feature or disable it.  Awsome worth the download.  Mr. Braun,  keep up the good work and looking forward to seeing what you come up with next.  Fabian - Canada

title: Amazing!
comment: I can't say enough good things about this app and its developer. It's so perfect, I almost want to cry. I have a TPT and its one of the few apps that takes advantage of the N-trig pen but definitely the best in terms of responsiveness and accuracy of pen strokes. Even for owners of non-stylus tablets, I would highly recommend this app. Dev keeps regularly updating and add new features to an already amazing app. What more could one ask for? This deserves a lot more recognition than it gets.

title: Amazing!!! Stopped carrying my Diary ! Best Note taking App
comment: Just what I was looking for ! Works jem in flyer, keep up  the gr8 work and thanks for this. Would be nice to see   more features added in the upcoming updates. 1. Better folder organising. 2. Moving pages across different notebooks. 3. Option to choose the Eraser size. 4. Different page templates ie. To Do, Agenda, Daily Diary ,with different page colour rather than just white. 5. Password Protection. 6. Easy access to clear / Delete pages, ideally inside the Red button.  Thanks !

title: BEST notes app
comment: Since this syncs with Evernote, it's the BEST notes app I've found. Evernote is great but doesn't have the advanced features for tablet with a stylus. I have both installed anyway. However, the hand/finger rejection in Quill is perfect, the zoom works how you'd want it to with regard to the pen and drawing size, the backgrounds are great (I wish you could import your own background image though), and the export is perfect. You can't go wrong with this app, it should easily be double the cost. If you have an HTC Flyer like I do, THIS is the app that HTC should have shipped with on their device.

title: Very good
comment: Just purchased it, still figuring it out. Can See great potential.

title: Best Stylus/Pen Input for Tablet!
comment: I have been looking for months for an app as well implemented as this.  Absolutely the best and way too cheap, I would pay more.  Only two suggestions.  I think that a user configured level of zoom that centers on the area of double tap would be very helpful for those of us who like to write small.  Also, because of higher zoom I need to scroll alot.  Genial writing and FreeNote have this figured out using a writing bar.  Incorporate these two suggestions and this will be a 5 star application for me.   Really, hats of to the dev.  this is great.  Thank You!

title: OK but
comment: One of the better more basic notetakers and for one dollar will have a place in my tablet  But yes Insert images Add better palm support Highlighter? Checklists. Lists etc

title: It's only $1
comment: Debated to buy till it mentioned a charity they would donate the proceeds to so I forked out the buck. First thing I noticed was that you can't make dots with just a tap (annoying at best). Then after playing with it I found there was no exit button to exit the app ... Also annoying since I don't need it running in the background all the time. Other then that it looks good on the surface but haven't had a chance to take notes in class with it yet (the true test!) -- Moto Xoom 4G/Bamboo touch cap. stylus

title: Excellent for the HTC Flyer
comment: Provides many missing functions from the stock note taking app on the Flyer, much better zoom, different backgrounds and resolutions - exactly what I was looking for!

title: Very good
comment: Best hand writing app so far. Works well on my Acer iconia a500 .

title: Best dollar I've EVER spent!
comment: I mistakenly bought this app, only to quickly realize that this was the best dollar I've spent.  It was everything I could ask for: Digitizer pen support, PDF export, and tagging.  I did final exam reviews on it, and I did not have any stray marks whatsoever!  I do wish that the PDF export function supported the variation in stroke pressure

title: Great app! Thou some suggestions.
comment: Great application! Works great on my Lenovo Tablet. Have some suggestions to the author. First one is adding a new writing tool "marker" for painting the background behind the text. Extremely useful for emphasizing text. I am using Quill very heavily. Already migrated all my notes and writings to the Quill. Its my main application for writing at university or business meetings. Selection marker is a must tool. The idea came up while was at Microsoft courses I am currently attending. Wanted to highlight just the console commands for the PowerShell so I can easily review them later. In the header there is enough space for adding new "marker" icon. Hope other users will support the idea. Second suggestion is to add "slide" support for next/previous page since "sliding" is so called native interface of almost all Android apps. Using hardware volume buttons is not that good. Or at least add on-screen icons for next/previous page somewhere in the middle of the page (like the one that shows up in toolbox). Third one is not that important but will mention it anyway. Please add exit/quit command either on < icon or in menu. Hope my suggestions will make Quill more natural and intuitive.

title: Want a palm pad
comment: This app is very good with great screen responsiveness. I strongly want this app to have moveable palm pad like Note Plus for I pad.

title: The app that made my ThinkPad useful
comment: Great app to take notes in classes (I use it for engineering classes with equations, diagrams etc). It's already worth 5 stars and gets even better every week. Great work!

title: One of the Best Note Taking App for the Tablet
comment: VERY PROMISING----The Quill app has all the potential to be the best note taking on the market. I bought my Lenovo tablet specifically for the digitizing pen but was very disappointed with the note taking app they provided.  Quill has provided some of the punch that was lacking on my tablet.  It still lacks some of the following key features: (1) Abitility to restore a backup from Dropbox, Evernote or Box, (2) Poor flow while working between several different notebooks (Antipaper does a nice job here), (3) Unable to import pictures or PDFs into your notebook, (4) Cannot cut, move and paste notes, (5) No thumbnail view to add, rearrange or delete a specific page (6) Cannot change pen styles, thinkness & color directly from the header and (6) No support contact info.  If the creator can continue developing this app and adds most of these features, he will have a real WINNER!

title: Almost Perfect
comment: Writing and Drawing is exactly what the dev says it is.  My only major issue is that I use handwritten notes mainly to upload comments to a blog.  An acutal share function would be perfect.

title: need insert picture
comment: if it can crop picture from other screens like website ,it would be perfect.

title: Works on HTC Jetstream
comment: Fast, very responsive, and the pressure variation is superb!! This is WAYYY better than the Notes app that came with the device.  I am grad I found this app!

title: Worth the dollar
comment: The recognition for this app is amazing. My one complaint is the lack of organization for notes. If a notebook system, or something more sophisticated than tagging could be implemented, this would be a 5

title: Fast, Clean, Useful
comment: Very fast and responsive for writing or drawing. I love that it can save vector PDF that can be printed clearly when enlarged. Any problems someone might have using Quill would be solved if they looked at the settings options.

title: Was good from the start and it keeps improving
comment: I gladly purchased this. I found the note software that came with the Lenovo tablet lacking. I hoped this would get me started with paperless notes. It did.  The latest updates make this app perfect for my needs.  PDF export is rapid now, and the tagged notes feature lets me have virtual notebooks within the single notebook.   I backup the data to my desktop with Docs to Go and I export tagged notes as PDF notebooks that migrate to my desktop.  Thank you for a great app that you keep making better.

title: Mediocre
comment: Gestures to zoom and move didn't work properly, draw too fast and it would zoom in and out. No undo??

title: Clean, Simple, Works, Responsive
comment: This is truly a must-have app if you own a Thinkpad Tablet. If you want to replace your paper notebook that you have, this is the app to get. The notes are also in drawn in vectors with means everything will be crisp. I downloaded it for free to test it out and it has been improving very quickly with the updates, so much so that I actually paid a dollar for it. Coming from me, being very stingy with spending money on apps, means a lot. I hope the developer continues to make it even better with this.

title: Nice and simple
comment: This is a great app. Nice and easy to write on.  It is still in early development, so lacking some features. Especially, I would like to be able to set some defaults for export (e.g., page size). It would also be good to have some other export/sharing  options (e.g., via dropbox). Also, erasing via pen button would be nice.

title: Fast, Simple, and Effective
comment: I really like this. It's far better than Notes Mobile app that comes standard on the Lenovo Thinkpad Tablet Slate. The tag idea of organizing pages is pretty good if you plan ahead. I find that going back to tag individual pages can be really tedious. A nice addition would be some sort of interface for doing batch tagging... or perhaps even sorting simply by date?  The pen only (palm rejection) is amazing!

title: great features, fast, accurate, cheap
comment: As the title says. This app includes the great feature of pen only input (can't write with your finger if enabled). Very smart yet simple! Please enable the pen button. Better yet, let it be programmable!

title: Fantastic!
comment: I too have a Thinkpad Tablet, and was unimpressed with the default Notes application. The palm rejection was good, but not great. Quill's settings allows you to completely disable finger/palm touch, which is excellent for my needs.   The responsiveness is excellent, almost no lag when writing, far better than the default notes application.   Overall, writing with Quill feels just a good, if not better, than writing on a full tablet with a wacom digitizer.

title: Quickly becoming the best for note taking
comment: I've tried nearly ever note taking app in the Market for my Thinkpad Tablet. Noticed developers post in a forum soliciting feature suggestions and decided to try this one. So far I have been extremely pleased, especially with the developers speed in adding new functionality and taking feature requests from users.

title: By far the best
comment: If you have a Thinkpad Tablet or use a stylus this is by far the best application out there for taking notes. The developer has made great efforts to gather community feedback and  makes frequent updates based on user requests. If you like it, please buy it and show your support!

title: Must have real note-taking app
comment: Wonderful app. Must have if you own a ThinkPad Tablet. Most responsive real note-taking app available. Great developer who also listens to end users. Using exclusively for in-class note-taking.

title: awesome
comment: With pressure sensitivity, awesome speed and vector based workflow, this is the best of its kind.  Muchos kudos for making it.  Now just needs a .jpg (or something raster) export option and I'll be using it exclusively!

title: Best note taking app out there
comment: If you have a Thinkpad Tablet this is an absolute must have!
